author: Nistula Hebbar
text:
With talks between the ruling alliance partners gaining pace in Jammu and Kashmir after BJP leader Ram Madhav paying a less-publicised visit to Srinagar to meet PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti, several issues were thrashed out between the two parties.

Sources said three issues were flagged at the meeting between BJP president Amit Shah and PDP leader Haseeb Drabu, Finance Minister in the previous PDP-BJP government.

“The first was about re-examining the financial package announced earlier for flood relief in the State. The second was the handover of National Hydroelectric Power Corporation projects in Dulhasti and Uri to the State. The Centre may grant funds to the State government to buy into these projects and take a majority stake,” a top source said.

The third issue was the inclusion of Srinagar in the Centre’s flagship Smart City plan.

“No call has been taken on the withdrawal of the Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act,” the source said.

With the death of Chief Minister Mufti Mohammad Sayeed, the State has been without a government for long, nearly a year after the PDP and the BJP formed one after striking an unlikely alliance. Ms. Mufti, who took over the reins of the PDP after her father’s death, insisted on a full mourning period and time to resolve pending issues with the BJP. This resulted in Governor’s rule in the State, with Governor N.N. Vohra taking charge of things.
title: PDP seeks a larger package for flood relief
